definition: The professional discernment required to make editorial decisions, balancing rules, context, author intent, and reader needs

positive_examples: Editorial judgment recognized that the sentence fragment was intentional for stylistic effect.
The editor's judgment balanced house style against preserving the author's distinctive voice.
Editorial judgment determined which inconsistencies were errors versus intentional variations.
Good editorial judgment knows when to query the author versus making silent corrections.
Editorial judgment recognized that querying the author was better than silently making the change.
training_hints.disambiguation: Contextual professional discernment, not rule-following or arbitrary choice
